definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: She stuffed her clothes in and then tried to close the lid.
sentences.chinese: 她把衣服塞进去，想盖上盖儿。

sentences.english: When I open the cover of rice cooker, my mind is filled with expectation!
sentences.chinese: 开电饭锅的盖儿的时候我的心是期待是一杯。
我要给这个箱子盖上盖儿。

sentences.english: My father nailed the cover of the jar down so that the air wouldn't come in.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把罐子的盖儿钉住，这样空气就进不去了。

sentences.english: He screwed the lid on the jar.
sentences.chinese: 他旋掉了坛子上的盖儿。

sentences.english: Fasten the lid on the jar.
sentences.chinese: 拿盖儿把这个罐子盖紧。

sentences.english: Lighter does not self extinguish close lid to put it out.
sentences.chinese: 打火机不会自己熄灭，要熄火盖盖儿。

sentences.english: Gabriella invited Jordan to enjoy New Year's Eve dinner together.
sentences.chinese: 加布里盖儿邀请乔丹一起吃年夜饭。

sentences.english: Where's the top of the jam jar?
sentences.chinese: 果酱罐子的盖儿在哪儿？
他旋掉了坛子上的盖儿。

sentences.english: He uncovered the dish and showed us the food.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开盘子的盖儿给我们看吃的东西。

sentences.english: I cannot fit the lid on this box.
sentences.chinese: 我盖不好这个箱子盖儿。

definition: to unscrew/to twist off (a lid)/to turn on (a faucet)/to switch on (by turning a knob)/to turn (a door handle)/to wrench apart
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
to close up/to heal (of wound)/to keep one's lips sealed
jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
